newsitem.title: UK: Crown Leisure places shares at 77p before float.
newsitem.headline: Crown Leisure places shares at 77p before float.

text.p: Crown Leisure Plc, a UK amusement game operator and distributor, said on Friday it had placed 9.7 million shares at 77p with institutional shareholders and said they would debut on the London Stock Exchange on December 19.

Chief executive Mike Gemson said the flotation was a "significant step forward" adding: "We expect many more business opportunities as a result of our new found status and profile... we expect to deliver enhanced value to our shareholders."
Crown said it had raised five million stg of new capital from the placing, to be used to repay company debt.
Crown said it intended to strengthen its position via organic growth and acquisitions, and would make the most of opportunities resulting from deregulation in the sector.
Founded in 1976, the company is the fifth largest operator of rented machines and one of the largest wholesale distributors of coin-operated amusement machines in the UK.
The company said it expected its pre-tax profits to rise to 1.36 million stg in 1996 from 1.21 million in 1995.

The 9.74 million shares, valued in total at 7.5 million stg, comprise an issue of 6.49 million new shares and a sale of 3.25 million existing shares by NatWest Ventures, which provided development capital to Crown in 1993.
